description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家，皖系军阀首领。历任参谋总长、国务总理、临时执政等职。因在要求清帝退位、抵制洪宪帝制和讨伐张勋复辟中的作用，有“三造共和”之美誉。
description.en: A Chinese politician and warlord, leader of the Anhui clique. He served as Premier and Provisional Chief Executive of the Republic of China. He is known for his role in forcing the Qing emperor's abdication, resisting the Hongxian Monarchy, and suppressing the Manchu Restoration, earning him the moniker 'the three-time creator of the Republic'.

description.zh-cn: 段祺瑞之父。
description.en: Father of Duan Qirui.

description.zh-cn: 段祺瑞之母。
description.en: Mother of Duan Qirui.

description.zh-cn: 段祺瑞的原配妻子。
description.en: Duan Qirui's first wife.

description.zh-cn: 段祺瑞的第二任妻子，袁世凯的表侄女。
description.en: Duan Qirui's second wife, a niece of Yuan Shikai.

description.zh-cn: 清末由李鸿章在天津创办的军事院校，是中国近代第一所陆军军官学校。
description.en: A military academy founded in Tianjin by Li Hongzhang during the late Qing dynasty, it was the first modern army officer school in China.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪末德国的军事教育机构。
description.en: A military educational institution in Germany in the late 19th century.

description.zh-cn: 中国清末民初的军事家、政治家，北洋军阀的奠基人，中华民国第一任正式大总统。
description.en: A Chinese military and government official during the late Qing dynasty and the early Republic of China, founder of the Beiyang Army, and the first formal President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯意图恢复帝制、建立中华帝国的政治运动。
description.en: A political movement by Yuan Shikai to restore the monarchy and establish the Empire of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家，曾任中华民国第一任副总统和第二、三任大总统。
description.en: A Chinese politician who served as the first Vice President and the second and third President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 指中华民国北洋政府时期，大总统府与国务院之间的权力斗争，主要发生在黎元洪与段祺瑞、冯国璋与段祺瑞之间。
description.en: Refers to the power struggle between the Presidential Palace and the State Council during the Beiyang government period of the Republic of China, primarily between Li Yuanhong and Duan Qirui, and later Feng Guozhang and Duan Qirui.

description.zh-cn: 由张勋领导，旨在恢复清朝帝制的短暂政治事件。
description.en: A short-lived political event led by Zhang Xun aimed at restoring the Qing dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事将领，“北洋三杰”之一，直系军阀首领，曾任中华民国代总统。
description.en: A Chinese general, one of the 'Three Distinguished of Beiyang', leader of the Zhili clique, and acting President of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 直系军阀与皖系军阀之间为争夺北京政府统治权而爆发的战争。
description.en: A war fought between the Zhili and Anhui cliques for control of the Beiyang government.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事将领，西北军领袖，因其部队被称为“基督将军”。
description.en: A warlord in the Republic of China, leader of the Guominjun, known as the 'Christian General'.

description.zh-cn: 由冯玉祥发动的军事政变，推翻了直系军阀控制的曹锟政府。
description.en: A military coup launched by Feng Yuxiang that overthrew the Zhili clique-controlled government of Cao Kun.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事将领，直系军阀首领，曾任中华民国大总统。
description.en: A Chinese warlord, leader of the Zhili clique, and President of the Republic of China.

nodes.id: 中华民国临时政府 (段祺瑞)

zh-cn: 中华民国临时政府 (段祺瑞)

description.zh-cn: 1924年甲子政变后，由段祺瑞在北京成立的政府，段祺瑞任“临时执政”。
description.en: The government established in Beijing by Duan Qirui after the 1924 Beijing Coup, in which he served as the 'Provisional Chief Executive'.

description.zh-cn: 段祺瑞执政府卫队开枪镇压北京学生和市民的请愿游行，造成大量伤亡。
description.en: An incident where guards of Duan Qirui's government fired on protesters in Beijing, resulting in numerous casualties.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事将领，冯玉祥麾下“五虎将”之一。
description.en: A general in the Republic of China, one of the 'Five Tiger Generals' under Feng Yuxiang.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家及军事家，曾任中华民国总统及中国国民党总裁。
description.en: A Chinese politician and military leader who served as the leader of the Republic of China and the Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 日本陆军大将，甲级战犯，长期在中国从事特务活动。
description.en: A general in the Imperial Japanese Army, a Class A war criminal, who was instrumental in Japanese espionage activities in China.

description.zh-cn: 由段祺瑞等四十六名北洋军将领联名发出，要求清帝退位、实行共和的电报。
description.en: A telegram jointly issued by 46 Beiyang Army generals led by Duan Qirui, demanding the abdication of the Qing emperor and the establishment of a republic.

description.zh-cn: 光绪帝的皇后，宣统帝的皇额娘，清朝最后一位实际掌权者，代表宣统帝颁布了退位诏书。
description.en: The empress consort of the Guangxu Emperor, adoptive mother of the Xuantong Emperor, and the last de facto ruler of the Qing dynasty who issued the abdication edict on behalf of the emperor.

description.zh-cn: 皖系军阀的重要人物，段祺瑞的得力干将和主要谋士。
description.en: A key figure in the Anhui clique and Duan Qirui's chief subordinate and strategist.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国北洋政府时期的一个军阀派系，由段祺瑞领导。
description.en: A warlord faction during the Beiyang government era of the Republic of China, led by Duan Qirui.

description.zh-cn: 皖系军阀为操控国会选举而成立的政治团体，因在北京安福胡同开会而得名。
description.en: A political organization formed by the Anhui clique to manipulate parliamentary elections, named after its meeting place on Anfu Hutong in Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 清末民初的一支现代化中国军队，由袁世凯建立，是北洋军阀势力的基础。
description.en: A modern Chinese army established in the late Qing dynasty by Yuan Shikai, which formed the basis of the Beiyang warlords' power.

en: Premier of the Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华民国北洋政府时期的政府首脑。
description.en: The head of government during the Beiyang era of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 由孙中山领导，旨在维护《中华民国临时约法》，反对北洋政府统治的政治军事运动。
description.en: A political and military movement led by Sun Yat-sen to protect the Provisional Constitution of the Republic of China against the Beiyang government.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命家，中华民国国父，中国国民党创始人。
description.en: A Chinese statesman, physician, and political philosopher who served as the provisional first president of the Republic of China and the first leader of the Kuomintang (Nationalist Party of China).

description.zh-cn: 张佩蘅是袁世凯的表侄女。
description.en: Zhang Peiheng was Yuan Shikai's niece.

description.zh-cn: 1885年考入炮兵科一期，1887年以最优等毕业。
description.en: Enrolled in the first class of the artillery department in 1885 and graduated with top honors in 1887.

description.zh-cn: 1889年春抵达柏林，在普鲁士军官学校学习军事理论与操练。
description.en: Arrived in Berlin in the spring of 1889 to study military theory and practice at a Prussian military school.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯在天津小站练兵时，段祺瑞主管砲兵。
description.en: When Yuan Shikai was training the New Army at Xiaozhan, Tianjin, Duan Qirui was in charge of the artillery.

description.zh-cn: 《共和之电》向隆裕太后施压，是促成清帝退位的关键文件之一。
description.en: The 'Telegram for the Republic' pressured Empress Dowager Longyu and was a key document in bringing about the abdication of the Qing emperor.

description.zh-cn: 段祺瑞联名发布《共和之电》并以武力威胁，向隆裕太后逼宫，促使其下诏清帝退位。
description.en: Duan Qirui co-signed the 'Telegram for the Republic' and used military threats to pressure Empress Dowager Longyu into issuing the abdication edict for the Qing emperor.

description.zh-cn: 《共和之电》由徐树铮起草。
description.en: The 'Telegram for the Republic' was drafted by Xu Shuzheng.

description.zh-cn: 段祺瑞表示不拥护袁世凯推行的洪宪帝制。
description.en: Duan Qirui expressed his non-support for the Hongxian Monarchy promoted by Yuan Shikai.

description.zh-cn: 因对德宣战等政事处理方向不同，两人爆发府院之争，黎元洪最终免去段祺瑞的总理职务。
description.en: Due to disagreements on policy, such as the declaration of war on Germany, the two clashed in the 'Mansion-Courtyard Rivalry', leading Li Yuanhong to dismiss Duan Qirui from his premiership.

description.zh-cn: 段祺瑞在天津马厂誓师，率讨逆军镇压了张勋复辟。
description.en: Duan Qirui rallied his troops at Tianjin's Machang and led the 'Rebel-Suppressing Army' to crush the Manchu Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 两人对于以何种方式统一中国意见相左，发生第二次府院之争。
description.en: The two had conflicting views on how to unify China, leading to the second 'Mansion-Courtyard Rivalry'.

description.zh-cn: 皖军在直皖战争中战败，皖系势力被瓦解，段祺瑞因此失势下野。
description.en: The Anhui clique's army was defeated in the Zhili-Anhui War, leading to the collapse of its power and forcing Duan Qirui to step down from office.

description.zh-cn: 冯玉祥发动甲子政变，推翻了大总统曹锟。
description.en: Feng Yuxiang launched the Beijing Coup, overthrowing President Cao Kun.

description.zh-cn: 冯玉祥发动甲子政变后，邀请段祺瑞出山，出任中华民国临时政府的临时执政。
description.en: After launching the Beijing Coup, Feng Yuxiang invited Duan Qirui to come out of retirement and serve as the Provisional Chief Executive of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 惨案的发生导致段祺瑞执政府众叛亲离，并最终于同年4月下野。
description.en: The massacre caused Duan Qirui's government to lose all support, leading to his downfall in April of the same year.

description.zh-cn: 1926年4月9日，鹿钟麟率部将段祺瑞驱逐，迫使其下野。
description.en: On April 9, 1926, Lu Zhonglin led his troops to oust Duan Qirui, forcing him to step down.

description.zh-cn: 九一八事变前，日本关东军特务机关长土肥原贤二多次在天津秘密会晤段祺瑞等人，欲扶植其为代理人。
description.en: Before the Mukden Incident, Kenji Doihara, head of the Kwantung Army's special service, secretly met with Duan Qirui and others in Tianjin multiple times, intending to install him as a Japanese puppet.

description.zh-cn: 为防止段祺瑞被日本人利用，蒋介石邀请其南下上海定居。
description.en: To prevent Duan Qirui from being used by the Japanese, Chiang Kai-shek invited him to move south and reside in Shanghai.

relationships.target: 中华民国临时政府 (段祺瑞)

description.zh-cn: 在冯玉祥发动甲子政变后，段祺瑞出山成立中华民国临时政府。
description.en: After Feng Yuxiang launched the Beijing Coup, Duan Qirui came out of retirement to establish the Provisional Government of the Republic of China.

relationships.target: 中华民国临时政府 (段祺瑞)

description.zh-cn: 1902年，徐树铮投奔段祺瑞并担任其记室，后成为其重要幕僚和亲信。
description.en: In 1902, Xu Shuzheng joined Duan Qirui as his secretary and later became his key advisor and confidant.

description.zh-cn: 段祺瑞为推行“武力统一”政策，派兵镇压孙中山倡导的护法运动。
description.en: To implement his policy of 'unification by force', Duan Qirui dispatched troops to suppress the Constitutional Protection Movement advocated by Sun Yat-sen.

description.zh-cn: 段祺瑞主张武力统一，与领导护法运动的孙中山在政治和军事上对立。
description.en: Duan Qirui advocated for military unification, placing him in political and military opposition to Sun Yat-sen, who led the Constitutional Protection Movement.
